title.narrative: OUTP 8.4: COMMUNICATIONS

description.narrative: Output 8.4: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 08: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND CHILD CARE

sector.narrative: Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.4: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issueswith stakeholders

description.narrative: UNICEF kept its audience and stakeholders informed and increased knowledge and awareness on the COVID 19 pandemic. UNICEF reached over 7 million people in 2021 with information on COVID 19 and updates on UNICEF’s programmes and over 11.7 million people with COVID 19 Risk Communications and Community Engagement (RCCE) information using mass communication approaches, feedback mechanisms such as U-Report, Internet of Good Things (IoGT) and other polls and surveys. UNICEF managed to create a positive image of the organization’s work in alignment with the donor visibility guidelines, with 100% of materials and communications with appropriate donor branding and visibility. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
